questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions.

a. Why can humans neither change the sun's radiation nor the earth's orbit around the sun?

b. Describe how human beings are responsible for the increase in the greenhouse gases.

c. What do you think the main cause of the increase in carbon dioxide level in the atmosphere is?

d. Why enormous areas of forests are destroyed by the people every year? Describe in brief.

sub_questions.explanation:
(a) Humans can neither change the sun's radiation nor the earth's orbit around the sun, because these things are beyond their control.

(b) Human beings do some unwise activities like burning too much fossil fuels, setting up more factories, cutting down trees indiscriminately, etc. that result in the increase of greenhouse gases. Thus, they are responsible for the increase in the greenhouse gases.

(c) I think the main cause of the increase in carbon dioxide level in the atmosphere is the burning of fossil fuels. With the increase of industrial activities, the combustion of coal has increased. Besides coal, mineral oil and natural gas are also burned for various purposes. Thus, every time a fossil raw material is burned, it releases carbon dioxide into the air.

(d) Enormous areas of forests are destroyed by the people every year to obtain wood and to clear regions for mining and to create pasture.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions:
a) Why is 21 February a memorable day in our national history?
b) Who is responsible to raise a storm of protest and how? Describe.
c) How did the Pakistani government try to prevent the protest?
d) What did the students of Dhaka University do against the declaration of outlạiving all sorts of public meetings and rallies?
e) How is Language Movement related to Independence Movement of Bángladesh?

sub_questions.explanation:
a. February 21 is a memorable day in our national history because on this day in 1952, the heroic son's of Bengal laid down their lives to establish Bangla as a state language of the undivided Pakistan. On this day, we pay tribute to the language martyrs because of their sacrifice for the rightful place of mother tongue.
b. The then Governor General of Pakistan, Mohammad Ali Zinnah, is responsible to raise a storm of protest. In a public meeting in Dhaka, he declared Urdu as the only state language of Pakistan, which disregarded the language rights of the Bangalee. Therefore, a mass protest started across the country.
c. The Pakistani government banned all sorts of public meetings and gatherings to stop the protest that began following Mohammad Ali Jinnah's declaration of Urdu as the only state language of Pakistan and continued non-stop.
d. Against the declaration of outlawing all sorts of public meeting and rallies, the students of Dhaka University brought out a peaceful protest procession on 21 February, defying the law.
e. The Language Movement of 1952 kindled the sparks of independence movement in East Pakistan by making the Bangalees aware of their rights. Thus, the Language Movement is related to the independence movement of Bangladesh.

b) How do the values of the Islam family reflect their dedication to their community?
c) In what ways does Mr Islam find contentment in his village life?
d) What can be inferred about the impact of education on the choices made by the Islam brothers?
e) What message do the Islam brothers convey about the relationship between one's roots and professional aspirations?

sub_questions.explanation:
(a) The sense of obligation to his village motivated Mr Islam to remain in that place instead of pursuing a career in the city. He wanted to work as a farmer, live with his family, and be close to his roots.
(b) To Mr Islam and his brothers, the purpose of education is not only to pursue office jobs but also to contribute to their community. Despite being highly educated, the Islam brothers did not run after a conventional career like most people. Instead, they remained in their village and chose work that aligned with their academic background.
(c) Mr Islam finds contentment in his village life through simple yet meaningful activities such as working on his own farm, resting in his own house, spending time with his family and reconnecting with old friends.
(d) It can be inferred that education helped Islam brothers understand the significance of one's obligation towards his/her community. Realizing this obligation, they contributed actively to their community from their respective fields.
(e) The Islam brothers convey an inspiring message about the relationship between one's roots and professional aspirations. They believe that the role of education goes beyond personal gain and it should also serve the community. As sons and daughters of the soil, it is our responsibility to utilize our learnings for the betterment of our roots.

In Ms. Hill's class, Jobs felt he was special. At the end of the fourth grade, Jobs did very well. It was clear not only to Jobs and his parents but also to the teachers that he was exceptionally intelligent. The school proposed that Jobs should skip two classes and go into the seventh grade. He was one of the ten students to go out in a procession on 21 . February 1952 despite a ban on such activities imposed by the authorities. As a result, he and many others were arrested and taken to prison. Zahir was also present at the historical meeting of Amtala on 21 February 1952. He also took part in the mass movement in 1969. Besides, his great documentary on Pakistani atrocities, 'Stop Genocide', helped create world sentiment in favour of our liberation war.
On 30 December 1971, someone informed Zahir about an address somewhere at Mirpur, where he might find his brother, the famous writer Shahidullah Kaiser. Shahidullah was captured and killed by the Pakistani army and the local collaborators during the last days of the war. Accordingly, Zahir left home to get his brother back but he never returned. questions.uddipok:
Everyone must play a part in protecting the environment. There are many things you can do on your own every day to help save the planet. Here are some suggestions.
REDUCE!
Really, the best thing we can do for the planet is to use its resources properly. Our unplanned activities are mainly responsible for the environmental crisis. Here are some questions you can ask yourself before buying something, "Do 1 really need this?" or "Is there another product which would do the same thing but more sustainable?" Or ask the question, "Will this last a long time?" Some other questions may be, "Do I know how this item was made, how it will be used and how it will be disposed of?"
REUSE!
What do you think of using your own ceramic cup or mug at your school or local club? It means there are no plastic cups to throw away. You can wash it and reuse it every day. Unfortunately, we are encouraged to buy a new "improved" item even if the one we have can be repaired or reused. When we buy things, we should buy those that are durable; we should use them properly, and have them repaired when necessary. If we practise this, many things will not only last a life-time, but also be passed on for future use. However, if something is truly unusable for its original purposes, try to be more creative and think of how else it might be used. When you're done with it, think of whether someone else might be able to use it. You can donate some of the things to the poor. You may also sell some of your used items through personal advertisements in a local newspaper or in social media.
RECYCLE!
Rather than throwing an item out when neither you nor anyone else can make use of it, have it recycled. And if recycling is not possible, it is better to send goods to a landfill or have them burned up. Find out what types of materials can be recycled in your area. Clean and sort the materials before putting them out in the bin. Recycling your drink and food cans means there will be less trash in a resource recovery facility or landfill. Moreover, a company can use the old cans to make new ones.

His father, Faizur Rahman Ahmed, a police officer and writer was killed by Pakistani Military during the Liberation War of Bangladesh in 1971 and his mother is Ayesha Faiz. He passed SSC exam from Bogura Zilla School in 1965 and stood second in the merit list in Rajshahi Education Board. He passed his HSC exam from Dhaka College in 1967. He took his Honours and Master's in Chemistry from the University of Dhaka securing first class. He did his PhD from North Dakota State University. He worked as a professor of Chemistry in Dhaka University. Humayun Ahmed reached his peak of fame with the publication of his novel 'Nondito Noroke' in 1972. He wrote over 200 fictions and non-fiction books all of which were best sellers in Bangladesh.
His first television drama was 'Prothom Prohor'. It was followed by many dramas and drama serials. He also directed many films based on his own stories. For his outstanding achievements he was honoured with many awards including Bangla Academy Award (1981) and Ekushey Padak (1994). He died on 19 July 2012 at Bellevue Hospital in New York. He was buried in Nuhash Palli.
Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation:
Humayun Ahmed, a renowned Bangladeshi teacher, author, playwright, and filmmaker, was born on 13 November 1948 in Mohongonj, Netrokona. His father, Faizur Rahman Ahmed, a police officer and writer, was killed during the Liberation War in 1971. Humayun Ahmed completed his SSC from Bogura Zilla School in 1965, ranking second in the Rajshahi Board, and his HSC from Dhaka College in 1967. He earned his Honours and Master's in Chemistry from Dhaka University, followed by a PhD from North Dakota State University. He served as a professor of Chemistry at Dhaka University.
His literary career gained prominence with the novel Nondito Noroke in 1972, and he authored over 200 popular books. His first TV drama Prothom Prohor led to a successful career in television and film directing. Recognized with numerous awards, including the Bangla Academy Award (1981) and Ekushey Padak (1994), he left an enduring legacy. Humayun Ahmed passed away on 19 July 2012 in New York and was laid to rest in Nuhash Palli.

Milton was a great poet after Shakespeare. His father early decided that Milton was to have a literary career. At the age of 7, in 1615 he got himself admitted in Star Palace School. But Milton could not pay attention to his studies in this school. After a couple of years, he left the school and studied at St. Paul's School till 1624. In the succeeding year, John Milton entered Christ College in Cambridge. He took his M.A degree at the age of 24 and went to his father's house in the village of Horton. Milton's father, however, had faith in his son and allowed him to continue his studies at Horton from 1632 to 1638 . During his time, he made himself master of everything worth knowing in the literature of Rome, Greece, Italy, France, Spain and the Bible. In 1643, Milton met Mary Powel in a occasion and married her. But this great poet became blind in 1652. The idea behind his famous work 'Paradise Lost' developed after his blindness. 'Paradise Lost' saw the light of the day in the year 1665. Nine years after its publications, this great artist in literature died.
Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: Milton, a great poet, was born in 1608 . He studied at Star Palace School and St. Paul's School. He entered Christ College in Cambridge in 1625. He received his MA degree from this institution at the age of 24 . His father was highly optimistic about his son's potential. Milton made himself a master of the literature of Rome, Greece, Italy, France, Spain and of the Bible between 1632 and 1638 at his father's home in Horton. His great work Paradise Lost was published after his blindness in 1665. He breathed his last in 1674.

It was late summer, 26 August 1910. A little girl was born to a rich Catholic merchants' family of Albanian descent in a small town called Skopje, Macedonia. She was the youngest of the three siblings and was named Agnes Gonxha Bojaxhiu. Who could imagine at the time that this little girl would one day become the mother of humanity, loving and serving the poorest of the poor. Yes, we are talking about none other than Mother Teresa.

At the age of 12, she heard a voice from within that urged her to spread the love of Christ. She decided that she would be a missionary. At the age of 18 , she left her parental home. She then joined an Irish community of nuns called the Sisters of Loreto, which had missions in India.

After a few months of training at the Institute of the Blessed Virgin Mary in Dublin, Mother Teresa came to India. On May 24, 1931, she took her initial vows as a nun. From 1931 to 1948, Mother Teresa taught geography and theology at St. Mary's High School in Kolkata (then Calcutta). However, the widespread poverty in Kolkata had a deep impact on Mother Teresa and in 1948, she received permission from her superiors to leave the convent and devote herself to caring for the poorest of the poor in the slums of Kolkata.

For the contribution to humanity, she was awarded the Noble Peace Prize in 1979. She died at the age of 87 , on 5 September, 1997.
Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: The passage is about Mother Teresa, the mother of humanity. She was born in 1910 in Macedonia. Hearing a voice within her at an early age, she decided to be a missionary. So, she left home in 1928. She came to Kolkata after taking some training and took her initial vows as a nun. Here she taught geography and theology at St. Mary's High School. Being moved by the widespread poverty, she left the convent in 1948 to serve humanity. In 1979, she received the Noble Peace Prize for her contribution to humanity. This great woman died in 1997.

Interpol is the International Criminal Police Organization. It comes from the two words "International" and "Police". It stands for International Criminal Police Commission. It is a nonpolitical, non-racial and non-religious organization. Almost all the countries of the world are the members of this organization. So, all the nations cooperate with one another to trace criminals around the world. Its headquarters is in Lyon. According to international law, the police of one country cannot enter the territory of another country to catch the criminals. In such situations, Interpol helps to trace out the criminals. Every country has its representatives in Interpol. After the First World War, crimes increased considerably in Europe, especially in Austria. After committing crimes, the criminals used to go to some neighboring countries and hide themselves there. In order to arrest such criminals, John Scober, the then Police Chief of Vienna, called a meeting of the police officials of different countries in 1923. It was in this meeting that twenty countries jointly established Interpol. Its first head office was made in Vienna and John Scober became its President.
In 1938, Germany invaded Austria and, caused end to Interpol. After the Second World War, Flaurent Lovagy, Inspector General of Belgium Police revived it. Lyon became its new headquarters. In 1956, Interpol was given a new constitution.
Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: The passage tells about Interpol. This international organization was established to trace out the criminals around the world. It was established first after the First World War when maniy criminals fled away to different countries so that their governments could not punish them. It was revived after the Second World War, With the help of Interpol, now the countries can trace the criminals in other countries. Almost all the countries of the world are members of this organization. The headquarters of Interpol is located in Lyon.

On 23 June 2018, twelve Thai young footballers along with their coach went missing in a cave network in Chiang Rai province in Thailand. From the next day national and international community became worried for them. Their age was between 11 to 16 and their coach was 25 . The football team had been on an exploration to the cave network following a game. The group became stranded after monsoon rain caused the cave system to flood. The cave system named Tham Luang is 10 kilometres long. It is a snaking route which has a number of chambers already submerged in water. It look 6 hours to get where footballers were and five hours to come back to cave entrance. Thai rescuers began their expedition to find out them after the missing. International rescue team also joined them. On July 3, the footballers were discovered alive by a British diver. Spending nine days in darkness, they were suffering from hunger. A Thai rescuer died while he was supplying them food and other necessities. Getting weather forecast the rescue team planned to rescue them immediately. Navy divers had to lead the boys along the underway path from the cave. On July 8 , four boys were rescued. Finally all 13 were rescued in next three days.
Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: On 23 June, 2018, twelve Thai young footballers along with their coach were lost in a cave network in Chiang Rai province in Thailand. This sad incident drew much concern around the world. It occurred while they were exploring the cave network after a game. The group got trapped inside as monsoon rain submerged the cave system. The cave network was 10 kilometres long and known as Tham Luang. Expedition for the group was jointly conducted by Thai and international rescuers. On July 3, a British diver discovered them alive. A Thai rescuer lost his life while he was supplying foodto the stranded footballers. Finally all 13 victims were rescued on July 11.

Rabindranath Tagore was one of the most leading poets in the history of world literature. He was at the same time a poet, a novelist, a dramatist, a philosopher and a musician. He was born in the renowned Tagore family on 7May, 1861. After the completion of his house education, he was sent to school. But he did not like institutional education. So, arrangements were made at house for his proper education. In his thirteenth year, Rabindranath along with his father went to visit Himalayas. At the age of seventeen, he was sent to London to study law. But he studied literature with Professor Henry Morley only for a few months and then returned home. Only at the age of eight, he started composing poems. He wrote his poetic novel Banaphul at the age of fifteen. When he was sixteen, his poems and essays were being published in journals. After returning from England, he began to write tirelessly in all branches of literature. In 1911, he translated his poems of "The Gitanjali" into English which brought him the highest honour in the form of the Nobel Prize in 1913.
One year after his awarding of the Nobel Prize, he was made a knight by the British Government which he rejected as a protest against the atrocities of British Government at Jalianwalabagh. The University of Oxford honoured him with D.Litt., in 1940. Earlier in 1921, he laid the foundation of Viswa Bharati. At the age of eighty, Rabindranath Tagore breathed his last.

Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: The passage is about Rabindranath Tagore (1861 1941), a poet, a novelist, a dramatist, a philosopher and a musician. He was born in the renowned Tagore family. School life did not attract him much, and so, he was educated at home. However, at 17, he was sent to London to study Law. But he started to study Literature there. Rabindranath started to show his poetic talent very early in his life. In 1911, he translated his poems of 'The Gitanjali' into English for which he received the Nobel Prize in 1913. In 1914, he was made a knight, by the British Government, but he rejected it as a protest against the British atrocities. Rabindranath was also honoured with D.Litt. by Oxford University. He founded Viswa Bharati in 1921.

Yuri Gagarin was Russian pilot and astronaut. He was the first human to journey into outer space. He, on his spacecraft Vostok, completed an orbit of the earth on 12 April, 1961. Yuri Gagarin was born in the village of Klushino, Russia on March 9, 1934. His parents worked on a farm. He was the third of four children. In 1946, Gagarin completed his secondary education at Klushino. At the age of 16, in 1950, he entered a foundry steel factory near Moscow. He did his graduation from a vocational school in 1951. Then he took a training as Soviet Air Cadet at a local club where he learned to fly at first. He again graduated from a technical school in 1955 and he was recruited in the Soviet Army. He became a lieutenant in the Soviet Air Force in 1957. In 1960, Yuri was selected for Soviet space programme. On 12 April, 1961 he became the first human to travel into space and move round the earth. He died in 1968 in a plane crash.
Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: On 12 April, 1961, on the spacecraft Vostok, Russian pilot and astronaut Yuri Gagarin took the first journey into the outer space in the history of mankind. He was born as the third child to his farmer parents on March 9 , 1934. He completed his secondary education in 1946 at Klushino and at the age of 16 , he started working in a foundry steel factory near Moscow. After graduating from a vocational school in 1951, he took training as Soviet Air Cadet at a local club. After getting his second graduation degree in 1955, he joined Soviet army and became a lieutenant in the Soviet Air Force in 1957. As a selected candidate for Soviet space programme, he became the first human to travel into space. He died in a plane crash in 1968.

He was born in the village of Tambulkhana in Faridpur district on January 1903. He received his early education at Faridpur Welfare School. He obtained BA degree in Bangla from the University of Kolkata in 1929 and MA in 1931.
Jasimuddin joined the University of Dhaka in 1938 as a Lecturer of Bangla. He left the university in 1944 and joined the Department of Information and Broadcasting. He worked there till his retirement in 1962 as Deputy Director.
Jasimuddin collected more than 10,000 folk songs. He wrote poems, novels, memories, music etc. His major works Rakhali, Nakhsi Kanther Math, Sojan Badiar Ghat, Beder Meye and Madhumala. The major honours and awards that he received are President's Award for Pride of Performance (1958), D. Litt by Rabirdra Bharati University, India (1969), Ekushey Padak (1976) and Independence Day Award (1978). He died on 13 March 1976 and was buried ancestral home at Gobindapur.

sub_questions.explanation: Jasimuddin was a renowned Bengali poet, also known as Pollikabi for his vivid depiction of rural life in Bengal. He began teaching at the University of Dhaka in 1938 and later worked in the Department of Information and Broadcasting until his retirement in 1962. Jasimuddin collected over 10,000 folk songs and wrote various literary works, including Rakhali , Nakhsi Kanther Math , and Sojan Badiar Ghat . Bangladesh is blessed with huge inland open water resources. It has numerous rivers, canals, beels, lakes and vast areas of floodplains. Hakaluki haor is one of the major wetlands of Bangladesh. With a land area of 18,386 hectares, it supports a rich biodiversity and provides direct and indirect livelihood benefits to nearly 1 , 90 , 000 1,90,000 1 , 90 , 000 people. This haor was declared an Ecologically Critical Area in April 1999 by the government of Bangladesh. Hakaluki is a complex ecosystem, containing more than 238 interconnecting beels and jalmahals. The haor falls under two administrative districts, Maulvibazar and Sylhet. Some 1,90,000 people live in the area surrounding the haor. The haor is a very important resting place for migratory waterfowls flying in from the north, the most interesting species is the Barheaded Goose, which is now hardly seen in fresh water wetlands. Many other important species of waterfowls make the haor their temporary home. Unfortunately, illegal poaching has been a threat to the waterfowl population in this vast wetland. Hakaluki haor is known as a good grazing land in winter. People from villages around the haor and also from distant areas send their herds for grazing. During this time, herders make temporary shelters near the beels and graze their animals for a period of 4 to 5 months. The haor had very dense swamp forests in the past, but deforestation and lack of conservation practices have virtually destroyed this unique forest in the last two decades.

Write a summary of the above passage, in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: The passage is about Hakaluki haor, a significant wetland of Bangladesh, with an area of 18,386 hectares. It supports a rich biodiversity and provides a living for approximately 190,000 people. The government of Bangladesh declared it an Ecologically Critical Area in 1999. Hakaluki haor consists of interconnected beels and jalmahals, forming a complex ecosystem. It is home to various species of migratory waterfowls, including the endangered Barheaded Goose. Unfortunately, illegal poaching poses a threat to these birds. Furthermore, parts of the haor dry up, providing grazing land for cattle However, deforestation and lack of conservation efforts have severely impacted the once-thriving swamp forests in the area.

questions.uddipok:
Write a paragraph on 'A Rainy Day' answering the following questions:.
(a) How is a rainy day? (b) What happens in the rainy season? (c) What do people do on this day? How do the animals and birds pass this day? (d) What do the children do on this day? (e) How do you pass the day"?

sub_questions.explanation:
A Rainy Day
A rainy day is dull and gloomy. Sometimes, it drizzles and sometimes, it rains heavily all day long. The sky remains overcast with black clouds. The sun is hardly visible. Gusty wind blows from all sides. Birds keep standing on branches of trees or keep quiet in their nests. Cattle remain in their sheds and bellow for the fodder. Water stands here and there. Unpitched roads become muddy and slippery. Passers-by have to walk with umbrella over their head, shoes in hand and pants folded up to the knee. Sometimes people slip and fall on the muddy road. In cities, a rainy day is now a horror. The roads and streets in some towns and cities get flooded. Vehicles are seen stranding in knee-deep water in some areas due to water clogging. It causes gridlock across the city. It is a day of trouble and annoyance to the office-going people. They have to suffer from yarious inconveniences. But for the school going children, it is a delight to have a rainy day. If it rains heavily before their school time, they get a holiday. Sometimes, children, especially the boys play football in the rainwater in the nearby fields. A rainy day is a curse for the poor. The day labourers cannot go out for work and hence, they have to suffer a lot. However, I pass the day by listening to music, watching TV or reading journals. In short, a rainy day is a day of both pleasure and pain.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on 'Global Warming'.
(a) What is global warming? (b) What are the causes of global warming? (c) What are the effects of it? (d) How can we prevent global warming? (e) If we fail to prevent it, what may happen near future?

sub_questions.explanation: Global warming refers to the gradual increase in Earth's average temperature caused primarily by the buildup of greenhouse gases such as carbon dioxide, methane, and nitrous oxide in the atmosphere. The main causes of global warming include the excessive burning of fossil fuels, deforestation, industrial emissions, and agriculture, which release large amounts of these harmful gases. The effects of global warming are devastating and include rising sea levels, extreme weather events, loss of biodiversity, melting glaciers, and disruption of ecosystems. To prevent global warming, we can adopt renewable energy sources, plant more trees, reduce fossil fuel use, and promote eco-friendly practices. If we fail to prevent global warming, the near future may witness catastrophic consequences such as severe climate changes, increased natural disasters, massive displacement of people due to rising seas, and irreversible damage to life on Earth.

questions.uddipok:
Write a paragraph on "The Life of a Farmer" answering the following questions:
a) Who is a farmer? b) When does he start his daily work? c) How does he lead his life? d) What is his contribution to the nation? e) How can we improve his condition?

sub_questions.explanation: A farmer is an individual who cultivates crops and raises livestock to provide food, raw materials, and other essential products to society. A farmer’s day begins early, often before dawn, as he tends to his fields or animals, working long hours under varying weather conditions. The life of a farmer is simple yet demanding, requiring hard physical labor, patience, and a deep understanding of nature and the seasons. Farmers play a crucial role in the nation's economy by producing food, contributing to rural development, and ensuring food security for the population. Their hard work supports entire industries, from agriculture to transportation and retail. To improve the condition of farmers, it is essential to provide them with better access to modern farming techniques, financial support, fair market prices for their produce, and improved infrastructure for irrigation, transportation, and storage. Additionally, reducing the burden of debt and offering educational resources can empower farmers to thrive in their profession.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on "The Importance of Learning Computer".
a) Why is computer so important? b) Where do we use computer? c) What things can a computer do? d) Which jobs need the knowledge of computer? e) Why does a student need to learn computer?

sub_questions.explanation:
The Importance of Learning Computer
Computers have become an essential part of our daily lives, and they are used everywhere; from schools to businesses, hospitals to entertainment. One of the most significant advantages of learning computer is that it opens up many job opportunities. These days, almost all jobs require computer skills, and having this knowledge can give one an edge in the job market. But that's not all. Knowing how to use a computer can also make one more productive and efficient, which is helpful in any work environment. It can also help with education, as computers are used for research, writing, and online learning. Having computer skills can make studying and learning much easier and efficient. Besides, computer skills can help one communicate with people from all around the world with the help of internet.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on "A Winter Morning". You should write it in about 150 words.
(a) How is "A Winter Morning"?
(b) Why cann't people see the things from distance in a winter morning?
(c) What do the old people and children do to make themselves warm?
(d) What are the interesting foods of people in a winter morning?
(e) Do you like a winter morning? Why?

sub_questions.explanation:
A Winter Morning
A winter morning has its own exceptional natural aspects as well as its effects on human and animal life. A winter morning is misty and cold. There is dense fog everywhere. Sometimes, the fog is so dense that the sun-rays cannot get through it. Everything looks hazy. The scenery of a winter morning is really charming in rural areas. Dewdrops on grass and leaves sparkle like pearls in the sunrays. Generally, people wake up late in the morning. They shiver in cold. They wear warm clothes. Old people and children are found basking in the morning sun. People usually have date juice and various native 'pithas' as breakfast. Cattle remain in their sheds. However, in cities, a winter morning does not make much change in life as it is not too cold there. People wake up at their usual time, wear colourful warm clothes and go to their work place. Students are seen in the most colourful warm clothes. The nature is dull and gloomy here, too. Both in rural and urban areas, poor people are the worst sufferers. They do not have enough warm clothes to protect themselves from the biting cold. Street children gather straw and papers and make fire to warm themselves. The communication system is disrupted which causes much hardship to the people. However, the scenery of a winter morning is very transitory. It starts disappearing as the day advances. My personal feeling about a winter morning is that it is a bane for the poor, but a boon for the rich.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on 'Tree Plantation'. You should write it in about 200 words.
(a) What is tree plantation? (b) Why should we plant trees? (c) When and where can we plant trees? (d) How can we take care of trees? (e) What should the government do in this regard?

sub_questions.explanation:
Tree Plantation
Tree plantation means planting trees on a large scale in a planned way. Trees are our friends. They give us shade and soothe our eyes with their green colour. They give us various kinds of fruits. They give us firewood as fuel for cooking. They give us timber for furniture, doors and windows, boats, electric poles, railway slippers, etc. They give us rubber too. Trees take in carbon dioxide and produce oxygen. Sufficient trees cause sufficient rainfall and prevent draught. Trees along the roadside and coastal areas preyent erosion and tidal bore. But many inconsiderate pcople are cutting down trees for their selfish interests. So, we are losing trees. If there is no tree, there will be no civilization. In fact, the loss of trees will take our existence to the verge of extinction. The earth will be no more habitable. Hence, tree plantation must be taken as a project. The more we plant trees, the morė our environment will be balanced and greener. In Bangladesh, tree plantation is compulsory because we do not have as much forest as we require to maintain the ecological balance. There is no specific time to plant trees. We can plant trees any time of the year based on the type of the trees. Park, yard, urban areas, open field, balcony, rooftops; roadside places, etc. are best places to plant trees. To make life peaceful, there is no alternative to tree plantation.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on The Importance of Co-curricular Activitics in a School?
(a) What are the co-curricular activities?.
(b) Why are they important in a school?
(c) How do they help with learning?
(d) How do they help students grow personally?
(c) How do they prepare students for the future?

sub_questions.explanation: Co-curricular activities are those activities that complement academic learning and are an essential part of a school’s curriculum. They include sports, music, drama, art, debate, clubs, and other extracurricular pursuits that allow students to explore their interests outside of the traditional classroom setting. These activities are important because they provide students with opportunities to develop essential life skills such as teamwork, leadership, time management, and creativity. Co-curricular activities enhance learning by making it more engaging and practical, helping students apply theoretical knowledge in real-world contexts. They also contribute to personal growth by building confidence, self-discipline, and interpersonal skills. Additionally, by participating in a variety of activities, students gain exposure to different fields, which helps them explore their passions and strengths. Finally, co-curricular activities prepare students for the future by equipping them with a diverse set of skills that are highly valued in both higher education and the job market, making them well-rounded individuals ready to face challenges in life.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on "Your School Magazine".

(a) What is a school magazine?

(b) What is the name of your school magazine?

(c) How is the magazine committee formed?

(d) What does it contain?

(e) What is the importance of a school magazine?

sub_questions.explanation:
Our School Magazine
A school magazine is a periodical publication that contains the literary works and other information of a school. It is published once a year. We have a school magazine in our school. . To publish it smoothly, a magazine committee of usually nine members is formed in a general meeting. The members of the committee are chief patron, adviser, editor, assistant editors, business editors, proofreaders, assistant proofreaders, etc. The Headteacher holds the post of chief patron and a senior teacher becomes the adviser. The editor, business editors and the assistant proofreaders are selected from the students. A magazine fund is also made up from the school 'Magazine Fee'. The editor invites writings both in Bangla and English. Then, after proper scrutiny, the best ones are selected for publishing. The business editors collect some money by selling spaces in the magazine for advertisements. Generally, the magazine has two sections - Bangla and English. There are messages from the Headteacher and the Secretary of the school. There are also annual reports, essays, short stories, short plays, etc. in it. It also contains jokes, quizes and puzzles. Most of the articles are written by the students. A few articles are written by the teachers. A school magazine promoting team-spirit inspires to express the dormant power of thinking as well as writing of the young learners. It helps flourish themselves as future writers and poets.

questions.uddipok:
Write a paragraph on 'Your School Library' by answering the following questions.
(a) What is a school library? (b) Where is it situated? (c) What kinds of books are there in your school library?
(d) What is the use of your school library? (e) How can you borrow books from there? (f) What sorts of books do you borrow from the library?

sub_questions.explanation:
Our School Library

A library is the place where various kinds of books, newspapers, magazines, etc, are kept for readers. A school library is only for the teachers and the students of a school. We have an up-to-date library in our school. It is housed in a separate one-storey building. It is quite spacious and well-ventilated. The books are arranged systemically in different bookshelves. So, we have no difficulty in finding out the expected books. Our school library has a good collection of text and reference books. It has also books on different branches of knowledge like literature, history, science, commerce, geography, travels, biography and so on. Besides, it has a good supply of newspapers, magazines and journals. Moreover, there is a librarian in charge of our school library. He is well-trained, qualified and experienced. Every student has a library card. We can borrow two books at a time. Nobody is allowed to keep a book for more than two weeks. In the library; discipline and silence is strictly maintained. While studying in the reading room, students are strictly prohibited to talk or disturb others in any way. The calm and quiet atmosphere of the library helps the students to work attentively. Our school library plays an important role in enriching both our academic and general knowledge. It provides us with the opportunity to read different types of books. To us, it is a storehouse of knowledge. I think, every educational institution should have a library. To conclude it can be said that no educational institute is a complete one without a library.

sub_questions.explanation:
A Railway Station

A railway station is a place where trains arrive and depart to reach different destinations. It is a place where people from different backgroundṣ and cultures gather. It is mostly a busy place. A big station is always crowded with passengers, hawkers, and posters. The hustle and bustle of the station creates an atmosphere of excitement as travelers eagerly await their trains. The station is often crowded with people carrying luggage, vendors selling different food items, and families bidding farewell to their loved ones. The distinct sounds of trains arriving and departing, announcements over the loudspeaker, and the movement of people and trains contribute to the lively and energetic environment. Railway station is full of passengers, workers, hawkers, and shopkeepers. In a railway station, there are different platforms where the scheduled trains stop. There are waiting halls in railway stations where passengers can wait/ When the train departs from the station, it becomes deserted, and the buzzing sound of the passengers fades away. Outside the Railway Station, spots have been earmarked for parking of buses, taxis, rickshaws, and bicycles. questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on 'Environment Pollution' in 200 words.
(a) What do you mean by "Environment Pollution"? (b) What are the elements of Environment? (c) How are the elements being polluted? (d) What are the effects of pollution? (e) What should we do to get rid of environment pollution?

sub_questions.explanation:
Environment Pollution
The surroundings in which a person, animal or plant lives is called environment. There are many elements in our environment. Air, water, soil, plants, animals, etc. are such elements. They are essential for the environment as well as human beings. These elements should be sound for our sound living. But when they are polluted and their essential balance is disrupted, this phenomenon is known as environmental pollution. Nowadays, almost everywhere, the environment is being seriously polluted. In many places of our country, the environment has become extremely polluted. Actually, we ourselves are responsible for this severe pollution. Industries and factories emit huge amount of smoke, gases and fume. Motor vehicles also emit large amount of smoke and gases. All these pollute air seriously and polluted air is very harmful for us. Moreover, water is polluted due to dumping of industrial wastes and by chemical fertilizers and insecticides which are washed away into rivers and canals. Due to indiscriminate use of vehicle horns, loud speakers, mikes, etc. sound is polluted. Soil is polluted by harmful chemical fertilizers and insecticides. Besides, people are cutting down trees at random. All these are causing environmental pollution. Consequently, man becomes sick, animals and fishes are getting reduced, global warming is increasing, polar icecaps are melting, frequent floods are occurring and so on. So, we all should be aware of this harmful pollution and take effective measures to solve it.

A Tea Stall
A tea stall is a road side shop for people who go there to have tea as well as other snacks. A tea stall is very common both in towns and villages in our country. It usually sits at a crowded place. It is found in a market place, a square, a bus stand, a railway station and near schools and colleges. In a tea stall, usually, tea is served to the customers in exchange of money. But biscuits, bananas, cigarettes, betel leaves, some other snacks are also sold there. Though some tea stalls are well-furnished, most of them are poorly furnished. It is usually decorated with chairs, tables and benches. People go to a tea stall usually to take a cup of tea to remove their tiredness. A tea stall is kept open from early morning till late night. In a tea stall there are 'generally two people to manage and run it. One is a grown up man who prepares tea and takes bill from the customers, and the other is a young boy who serves tea, biscuits, etc. to the customers. Sometimes, people come to a tea stall in a group and raise a storm over the cup. They discuss about politics, daily affairs, various problems and what not. questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on 'COVID-19'.
(a) What is 'COVID-19'? (b) What are the symptoms of it? (c) How does it spread? (d) What is the treatment of it? (e) How can we prevent this virus?

sub_questions.explanation:
COVID-19

COVID stands for Coronavirus Disease. It is termed coronavirus or COVID-19 since it first infected humans in 2019. Coronavirus primarily spreads through physical contact and, respiratory droplets. People with COVID-19 may have a wide range of symptoms. These may appear two to fourteen days after exposure to the virus. The common signs include fever, dry cough, tiredness; loss of taste or smell, muscle aches, headache, sore throat, runny nose, vomiting, diarrhoea, etc. Some people may experience worsened symptoms like acute shortness of breath and pneumonia. Older people and those with underlying medical problems such as heart disease, diabetes, chronic respiratory disease and cancer are more likely to develop serious illnesses. Scientists around the world have invented some vaccines to boost our immune system for fighting coronavirus. Some of them are AstraZeneca, 'Pfizer. Moderna, Sinopharm, Sinovac, Sputnik V, etc. Though Bangladesh has invented a vaccine named Bangavax. , it is yet to be applied to human bodies. Besides, Molnupiravir, the first oral medicine for COVID-19. is now available in several countries. Still, preventive measures are the best ways to stay safe from COVID19. While going out, we must wear masks to cover our noses and mouth. We should thoroughly and regularly clean our hands with an alcohol-based hand rub or wash them with soap and water. We should avoid touching the face, nose and eyes as the virus can enter our body through them. Moreover, while sneezing or coughing, we should cover our face and nose with a tissue or with the elbow. In addition to that, we should maintain a social distance of a minimum of 3 feet. Anyone with the possible symptoms must be isolated to avoid close contact with others. Therefore, staying safe from COVID-19 mostly depends on personal hygiene.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on "Our National Flag".
(a) What is the symbol of independence? (b) What is its measurement? (c) What is it made of? (d) What is its colour? (e) What does green colour symbolize? (f) What does the red circle symbolize? (g) How can we uphold its honour?

sub_questions.explanation:
Our National Flag

The national flag of Bangladesh is a powerful symbol of the country’s identity, independence, and pride. It features a simple yet striking design: a red circle set slightly toward the hoist on a green rectangular field. The green background represents the lush greenery of Bangladesh, symbolizing the fertility, youth, and vitality of its land. The red circle signifies the rising sun and the blood of those who sacrificed their lives for the nation’s independence during the Liberation War of 1971. The flag’s design was first conceived during the early stages of the independence movement and was officially adopted on January 17, 1972. The flag reflects the country's struggle for freedom and its commitment to progress and peace. The red and green colors hold deep emotional significance for the people of Bangladesh, reminding them of their hard-won sovereignty and the resilience of their nation.
The national flag is prominently displayed on government buildings, schools, and public spaces during national holidays and celebrations such as Independence Day and Victory Day. It inspires a sense of unity and patriotism among the citizens. For the people of Bangladesh, their flag is not just a piece of cloth but a living symbol of their history, culture, and aspirations for a prosperous future.

questions.uddipok:
Write a paragraph on 'Early Rising' answering the following questions:

(a) What do you mean by early rising? (b) What facilities can an early riser get? (c) How does nature look early in the morning? (d) What opportunities does a late riser lose? (e) How can you form the habit of early rising?

sub_questions.explanation:
Early Rising

Early rising is a positive habit. It means that we should get up from bed early in the morning to enable ourselves to be ready for a new day. This fact, when made into a regular habit, will surely lead us to a world of bliss and prosperity. A proverb says, "Early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy and wise." Early rising has many benefits. The man who rises early in the morning can take some exercises or a walk in the fresh air by the riverside or in the open field. It makes our minds fresh and lively. Early in the morning, nature seems quiet and calm. No hue and cry are heard then. Nature smiles in the morning with colourful flowers and green leaves. Birds begin to chirp. These beautiful gifts and colourful nature in the morning remind everybody of the Creator. One feels like praying to the Almighty: But it is not easy to attain this quality. Sleeping late at night does not help in early rising. So, to rise early from bed, we have to go to bed early. An early riser enjoys the surroundings very much and gets enough time to do his work either in study or in other work, which will bring him success. On the contrary, if one gets up late, the schedule of his work becomes interrupted. Above all, early rising keeps us healthy and cheerful. For all these reasons, we all should cultivate the habit of early rising.

questions.uddipok:
Write a paragraph on 'Smart Phone' by answering the following questions:
a) What is a Smart Phone? b) What are the uses of it? c) What are the abuses of it? d) What are the effects of Smart Phone on human life? e) How can we control it?

sub_questions.explanation:
Smartphone
Smartphone refers to the mobile phone that has a touchscreen interface, an operating system capable of running different applications, the configuration of high-speed internet connection, and multimedia functions. The most common uses of smart phone are internet searching and web browsing. Other uses of smartphone are making phone call, listening to music, using social media apps, capturing and sharing photos and videos, etc. The effects of Smart phone on human life is huge. At present, there is hardly any person who doesn't have a smartphone. Smart phone has enabled' us to communicate with the people of the whole world in an instant. It has facilitated our life to a great extent. But alongside the huge number of benefits that we get from smart phone, it also brings about some troubles in our life. Access to huge number of data across the world through internet is a great threat to our creativity. It has also minimized our thirst for exploring the realm of knowledge that we are supposed to gain by participating physically in different expeditions. The smart phone has also expedited different kinds of cybercrimes. Many people, especially of young age, remain unnecessarily busy with browsing internet. Some people ate so obsessed in using internet that they behave in abnormal way. They cannot do much work in time due to wasting time in social media. To get rid of the abuses of smartphone, maintaining a strict schedule of work and increasing real life communication are effective ways. Besides, the parents should keep their children in close observation about their smart phone related activities. The government should adopt cybercrime law strictly to control abuses of smartphone. Thus, we all should control and be aware of the bad effects of smart phone.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on "Load Shedding.'
(a) What does the term 'load' shedding' mean? (b) What are the causes of load shedding? (c) How does it hamper us? (d) How can this problem be solved?

sub_questions.explanation:
Load shedding means the intentional and temporary suspension of electricity supply in a specific area when the demand for power exceeds the capacity of the national grid. It is a common problem in developing countries like Bangladesh. The primary causes of load shedding include a massive gap between the production and demand for electricity, system loss, illegal connections, and the shortage of fuel needed for power plants.
It hampers our daily life in numerous ways. Students cannot study properly at night, especially during exams. In hospitals, it affects critical surgeries and the operation of life-saving equipment. Furthermore, industrial production is severely disrupted, causing huge financial losses for the country. To solve this chronic problem, the government should take immediate steps to establish more power plants and upgrade the existing ones. Additionally, preventing illegal connections, reducing system loss, and encouraging the use of renewable energy like solar power can help minimize the crisis. Above all, we must be conscious and avoid wasting electricity in our daily lives.

questions.uddipok:

(a) What do you enjoy doing in your free time? Think about activities that you find relaxing, fun, or interesting.
(b) Can you name some different types of pastimes? Consider hobbies, sports, arts, or other activities.
(c) Which pastimes do you prefer the most? Why do you enjoy these activities?

sub_questions.explanation: In today's fast-paced world, finding moments of leisure is essential for maintaining a balanced and fulfilling life. I particularly enjoy reading the most because it allows me to see different worlds and learn new things. Painting is another hobby I cherish as it lets me bring out my latent creativity. I enjoy playing chess since I find it a brain-game. I also like playing badminton in winter because it has not only fun but also helps me stay active and healthy. I prefer spending my free time with friends and family as it makes the activities more enjoyable and creates cherished memories. However, I enjoy reading, cooking and painting doing alone. Cooking is also a kind of art to me. These new hobbies have been influenced by my growing desire to lead a healthier lifestyle and spend more time outdoors. Overall, my pastimes continue to bring joy and balance to my life.

questions.uddipok:
Write a paragraph on 'A Street Hawkar' answering the following questions:
(a) Who is a street hawker? (b) Where does he usually live? (c) How does he earn his livelihood? (d) How does he attract his customers? (e) How is his lifestyle?

sub_questions.explanation:
A Street Hawkar

A street hawker is a common sight in bustling towns and cities. He is a hardworking individual who earns his livelihood by selling goods on the streets. With a basket balanced on his head, a cart, or a portable stall, he roams from one neighborhood to another, calling out his wares in a loud, melodic voice to attract customers. Street hawkers often sell a variety of items, including fruits, vegetables, toys, snacks, or household goods. Their offerings vary with the time of day and the season, catering to the changing needs of the public.
The life of a street hawker is not easy. They face long hours under the scorching sun, unpredictable weather, and the constant challenge of competing with others for customers. Despite this, they often exude cheerfulness, as their survival depends on building relationships with their patrons. Hawkers bring convenience to people’s doorsteps, especially for those who cannot visit markets.
However, their presence can sometimes cause congestion and noise in busy areas. Nonetheless, they play an essential role in the local economy, offering affordable goods to people from all walks of life. A street hawker embodies resilience, adaptability, and the entrepreneurial spirit that thrives in urban life.

questions.uddipok:
Write a paragraph on 'A Street Accident' answering the following questions:
a) What is a street accident? b) Why is it caused? c) Have you witnessed any street accident? d) Where and when did it take place? e) How can street accident be reduced?

sub_questions.explanation:
A Street Accident
The accident that occurs on the streets due to face to face collision, break-failure or strong dash back of buses, trucks or any two other vehicles is called street accident. Last Sunday, I witnessed a tragic street accident. It took place near our school. There is a turning there. It is an interchange of five roads. Now and then, there occurs a traffic jam. On that day, while I was going to school, I saw a car coming from the western direction. A rickshaw, with a school boy and his mother, was coming from the opposite direction at about 8:30 a.m. While crossing the point, the car hit the rickshaw. The rickshawpuller was able to jump fróm his seat but the boy and his mother fell on the street. The boy and his mother were seriously wounded. I rushed to them. Some other passers-by also came forward to help them. We led them to a nearby doctor's chamber. I felt pity for the school boy, he was of my age. In fact, for having no traffic police at that place, such accidents frequently occur. The authority should take steps to stop road accidents that very often claim peoples' lives.

questions.uddipok:
Write a paragraph on "Climate Change" in about 200 words on the basis of answers to the following questions.
(a) What is climate change? (b) What are the causes of climate change? (c) What are the bad impacts of it? (d) What problems will Bangladesh face as a result of climate change? (e) What should we do to reduce the impacts of climate change?

sub_questions.explanation:
Climate Change
Climate change is the most important issue at present world. Its impact will be severely negative on both mankind and nature. The causes of climate change can be divided into two categories. They are due to natural causes and the causes created by men. Global warming is the main natural cause while using harmful chemicals in everyday life is the main cause created by man. The climate is changing rapidly that results in the rise of average temperature of the earth. The global climate changes and its consequences are leaving a bad impact on the developing countries like Bangladesh. The serious consequences of climate change are rising of temperature, erratic rainfall, floods, cyclones, draught, melting of polar ice-caps etc. which seriously affect the livings of the people of poorer countries. Bangladesh, for its geographical location, is likely to be the most affected. The developed nations which are more responsible for such climate changes should take responsibilities to protect the victimized countries. A one-meter rising of sea-level will submerge about one-third of the total area of Bangladesh which will uproot 25 − 30 25-30 25 − 30 million people of the country. These people will become refugees. To minimize the climate change, people should be aware. Tree plantation can reduce global warming. Avoiding the usage of harmful chemicals can reduce environmental pollution. Students should take necessary steps to protect the environment and raise awareness. They can make people aware of the bad sides of climate change. Thus, they can play a vital role to minimize the climate change.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on 'Traffic Jam'.
(a) What do you mean by traffic jam? (b) What are the causes of traffic jam? (c) What are the effects of traffic jam? (d) When does it occur more? (e) Who are the worst sufferers for traffic jam? (f) How can we remove it?

sub_questions.explanation:
Traffic Jam

Traffic jam is a situation in which a long line of vehicles on a road have stopped moving or are moving very slowly. Nowadays, traffic jam is a common problem in our towns and cities. It causes great sufferings to the passengers and the passers-by. The increasing number of vehicles mostly causes traffic jam. Day by day, the number of vehicles is increasing to meet the needs of the increased population. But the roads are not increasing in that proportion. Many vehicles moving on the same road at a timé' cause traffic jąm. Many drivers do not abide by traffic rules. Besides, the traffic police are not sincere. The tendency of the bus drivers and conductors to get more passengers also causes traffic jam. Some drivers stop buses here and there and board and unboard passengers. This hampers the movement of other vehicles and causes traffic jam. The unlimited number of rickshaws plying on the streets is another cause of traffic jam. The general people have to face untold sufferings. They reach late at their working places. Students, employees, businessmen, workers all suffer tremendously for this. It occurs mostly during office and school or college time. During fraffic jam, we feel extremely bored as it kills our valuable time. To relieve the passengers of the sufferings of traffic jam, some steps should be taken by the government. The drivers who do not abide by traffic rules should be punished. Traffic authority should be active to enforce the traffic rules and maintain the discipline on the roads.

questions.uddipok:
Write a paragraph on 'Drug Addiction' answering the following questions in 200 words.
a) What is drug addiction? b) What are the causes of drug adiction? c) How does it affect young generation? d) Why should young generation have knowledge on drug addiction? e) How can we rid of drug addiction?

sub_questions.explanation:
Drug Addiction
A drug is usually used as a medicine to cure diseases. But sometimes it is taken by some people as a habit to get amusement or relief from pain. This habit of taking the harmful drug is called drug addiction. Drug addiction is a curse of modern civilization. Nowadays, it has become a global problem. Drug addiction has grasped the young generation in our country. The people who take the drug cannot stop taking it. There are some reasons behind this addiction. Some take drugs to forget their painful past or present. Some take drugs in pursuit of pleasure. Some people, at first, take a drug as fun but afterwards, it turns into an addiction for them. The aftereffects of drug addiction are very harmful and serious. The health of the addicts breaks down. They lose their mental and physical power. They lose their social status and the love of their nearer and dearer ones as well. Everybody dislikes or hates them. Various kinds of diseases attack them. They suffer from amnesia, insomnia, nausea, physical weakness, blood pressure and from many other critical diseases. Their lungs, kidneys and livers are also damaged. Drugs are very expensive. So, the addicts often go for stealing, hijacking, killing and all sorts of misdeeds to manage money. For this reason, it should be stopped at any cost. Addiction to drugs can be checked by creating social awareness. The mass media can play an effective role in this regard. Seminars, discussions and debates should be held in schools, colleges and universities now and then. The government alone cannot solve this problem. People must cooperate with it. Above all, the rules of religion can play the most important role.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on 'A Book Fair':
(a) What is a book fair? (b) When and where is it held? (c) How popular is it? (d) Have you ever visitied a book fair? (e) What kind of books are usually available in a book fair?

sub_questions.explanation:
A Book Fair
A book fair is a kind of fair where different types of books are displayed for sale. Book fair is now held in every city and town too. It has recently become very popular in our country. People go to the fair to find their desired books. In Bangladesh, a book fair is arranged on the occasion of 21 s t 21^{st} 2 1 s t February, 16 th 16^{\text {th }} 1 6 th December, 26 th 26^{\text {th }} 2 6 th March and Bangla New Year. The fair is held in an open place or in auditorium or in a big hall-room. In our country, the largest book fair is held on the premises of Bangla Academy on the occasion of 21 t h 21^{th} 2 1 t h February. All kinds of books such as fiction, drama, poetry, novel, biography, translation, children literature, story books, etc. are usually available in a book fair. A book fair usually remains crowded. People from all walks of life visit the fair. People who are book lovers come to the fair to buy books and to enjoy the fair. Young boys and girls gather here to find out books of their favourite authors. They buy books to present them as gifts to their near and dear ones and for themselves. From the interest and participation of people, the popularity of book fair in our country can be realised. A book fair bears great importance. Moreover, it creates a sense of interest for books among the general people. It is really an exceptional place. It develops and flourishes our reading habits and thus makes us enlightened. It also helps develop our creativity.

questions.uddipok:
Write a paragraph on "Price Hike" by answering the following questions:
(a) What is price hike? (b) Why does price of things increase? (c) How do people suffer for price hike? (d)How can we control it? (e) What should we do to stop it?

sub_questions.explanation:
Price Hike
Price hike means rise in prices of essential commodities. It is a common phenomenon in our country. The prices of essential commodities are increasing by leaps and bounds. Indeed, price of daily commodities has gone beyond the reach of the common people. There are many causes of price hike. Insufficient supply of daily commodities is mainly responsible for price hike. Our population is increasing rapidly, but our food production is not increasing proportionately. For this, we do not get enough food in comparison to our increasing demands. Moreover, frequent natural disasters like flood, drought, cyclone, etc. hamper our food production, which accelerates the price hike of essential food items. On the other hand, hoarding is another important factor of soaring price level. Some dishonest traders devoid of morality hoard essential goods and create artificial shortage in the market. Then they sell the goods at higher price. Political unrest like strikes is also responsible for a surge in price. Lack of market supervision, black marketing and smuggling also contribute to price hike. The phenomenon has increased the suffering of the common people. The poor and the middle class are mostly affected by it. But, the worst sufferers of it are those who live from hand to mouth. They find it hard to feed their family members. Some of them remain half- fed. As a result, they suffer from malnutrition. Unusual price hike hampers the economic balance of a country. The government should take effective steps to tackle the situation, most notably by increasing food production. Each and every shop must have a price chart fixed by the government. The law enforcing agencies should be deployed in the market places to monitor the market price, Legal actions must be taken against the dishonest businessmen and hoarders. Actually, people of all walks of life should also co- operate with the government.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on "A Village Fair You Experienced".
(a) Where and when is a village fair usually held? (b) Who come to the fair and why? (c) When did you visit a fair and who were with you? (d) What did you do there? (e) Who enjoyed the most and why? (f) What is the role of a village fair in our economy?

sub_questions.explanation:
A Village Fair I Experienced

A village fair is a gathering of a large number of village people who get together to buy or sell goods in a festive manner. Usually, it is held on certain occasions like Pahela Baishakh, Puja, etc. It is held in an open place or by the bank of a river or canal. Various kinds of goods are displayed there for buying and selling. Everyone from children to the old gather there. People visit the fair to buy things and to enjoy. Last year, I had an opportunity to visit such a fair in my village. It was held on the occasion of Pahela Baishakh. I woke up early and went there with my cousins and friends. Traders came from far and near to sell their goods. They set up, their stalls with goods, such as toys, sweetmeat, cosmetics, jute and cotton handicrafts, bamboo-made goods and many more attractive items. We explored the fair till afternoon. In the fair, we ate some traditional food. I bought bangles, earthen and wooden showpieces from the fair. I bought some gifts for my family members too. We also enjoyed the ride on Merry-Go-Round, puppet show, magic show, circus and 'jatra'. It was, indeed, a memorable 'day for me. Such a fair plays an important role in our economy as it was a selling centre of various useful things made by the rural artisans and craftsmen

sub_questions.explanation:
The Boy Who Saved the Train

One sunny morning a boy of eleven years old was tending cattle by the side of a railway line. Suddenly he noticed a small railway slipper which was about to collapse. A little while later, he remembered that a mail train was supposed to cross in about half an hour. He thought that something should be done. Otherwise a serious accident might occur. He was thinking what to do: He was looking here and there but found none. Suddenly he remembered that if he showed red signal, the train might stop. As he was wearing a red shirt, at once he took oft his shirt and hung it with a stick. Then he began to wave it in the air. The driver saw it from far away and stopped the train slowly. He came to the boy and asked what happened. The boy took him to the railway slipper. Seeing it the driver thanked him and said that he had saved them. The next day the news was published in different newspapers. The government and many institutions awarded him for his ready wit.

I went there and after some time, I felt like someone was following me though I could not see anyone and a cold sweating grasped me. I.......:

sub_questions.explanation:
Pranks Are Not Always Fun
Load shedding is a common phenomenon in Bangladesh. During load shedding I would like to go on my terrace to enjoy fresh air specially at night. Last night, at 12:30 am when the electricity went off for a long time, I decided to spend some time on the terrace. I went there and after some time, I felt like someone was following me though I could not see anyone and a cold sweating grasped me. I got frightened when my phone rang. It was an unknown number. I thought it might be an emergency or something scary to me. My father was out on an official tour and suddenly it came to my mind that something might have happened to him. I received the call and asked who it was. No one replied but I heard that someone heaved a deep sigh.
It made me more scared and I repeated the same question. But the result was same; no one replied. After six or seven minutes, suddenly someone burst into laughter and hung up the phone. I was utterly horrified and confused. That incident made me so disturbed that I couldn't even concentrate on my studies anymore after coming downstairs. The next day, after finishing the exam, I came across a neighbour who revealed that he played a prank on me last night. He was just walking a little far from me on the opposite section of terrace and was trying to frighten me. I was so shocked that I asked for a reasonable answer. He told that he loved to play pranks on others but he meant no harm. I advised him not to do that again. All of us must be careful about our actions and shouldn't do anything which hampers the peace of others' minds.

A Liar Shepherd
There was a shepherd boy. He kept a flock of sheep near a forest. It was not far from his village. One day, he wanted to make a fun with the villagers. So, he began to shout, "Wolf! Wolf! Help! Help!" The villagers heard his cry and ran to help him. When they came near him, they found no wolf there and the boy laughed at them. The villagers were fooled by the cunning boy and hence, they went away. After a few days, he made the same fun and the villagers came again to help him but found no wolf there. One day, a wolf really came and it attacked the flock of sheep. The boy somehow climbed up a tree and shouted for help. The villagers heard him but they thought that it was his another fun and no one came to help him. The wolf killed one of his sheep and took it away. The boy felt sorry for his silly joke. From then, he promised not to tell a lie and befool people again.

Rumana was a student of class ten in Dhaka city. Every morning, she started for school and came back home in the afternoon. One day after coming back home, to her utter surprise, she found a lock hanging on the door. At first, she tried to open the lock with her key, but it did not budge. She knocked on the door, but no one answered. Panic set in, and she wondered what could have happened.
She felt alone and scared, but she didn't lose hope. She went to the back of the house to see if there was any way she could get in. Fortunately, one of the windows was open. She somehow managed to get inside. The first thing she noticed was that the house was in complete disarray. She realized that something was terribly wrong. Rumana immediately called her parents, and they rushed home.
After investigating, they found out that their house had been robbed while they were away. The robbers had taken all of their valuables, including jewelry, 'electronics, and cash. The incident taught Rumana the importance of being cautious and vigilant. She realized that security was a significant issue and that she needed to take measures to protect her family's belongings. In the end, the incident made Rumana stronger and more responsible. She learned to take charge of her life and to be prepared for the unexpected. She was grateful that she and her family were safe and sound.

questions.uddipok:

sub_questions.explanation:
Life is After all an Adventure

Once a school boy named Talha was returning from school. On the way to his home, he saw a boy of his age. The boy was working in a workshop. His body was covered with dirt, oil and other chemicals. Talha became curious about the boy. He asked the boy his name and learnt that people called him 'Falu'. He got even more curious. Going closer, he asked the boy what might be the reason that people gave him such a strange name. Falu said that he was left at the roadside just after his birth. He didn't know who his parents were. He used to beg at the town even to get something to eat. He had nowhere to go; none were there to support him. Finally, while begging at a bus stop, he met Kashem Ali, the owner of the workshop. That night Falu was starving, and was crying helplessly. At that miserable hour, God sent Kashem Ali in his aid. Kashem was a compassionate man and Falu's extreme miseries moved him much. He offered Falu a job at his workshop. And now, Falu was thankful to have a shelter and food to eat. Kashem Ali told him that he could start school from. next year. Falu looked dreamy; he was thinking about a better future. Talha, on the other hand, being greatly moved by the touching story of Falu's life, thanked God for all the privileges bestowed on him. Life is after all an adventure!

questions.uddipok: Read the beginning of a story. Add at least ten new sentences to complete the story. Give a suitable title to it: 10 Sufia is a worker in a big garments factory. sub_questions.explanation:
Look before You Leap
Sufia is a worker in a big garments factory. More than five thousand workers work in that factory. One day, while she was busy in work, a sound was heard, "Fire! Fire! Help! Help! As ill news runs apace, the news spread very fast, among the workers. But no one noticed whether there was actually any fire or not. Having just heard the news, without any confirmation, all the workers of the factory became desperate to come outside.
But the factory had only one exit and the path which led to this gate was very narrow. Even three men or women could not pass through this path side by side at a time. So, when all the workers of the factory were trying to come out along this narrow path, the path became congested with the workers. Many workers fell down on the path because of the jostling in the crowd and were trampled by other workers. Some of them received severe injuries. In a word, a chaotic situation had been prevailing in the factory.
After observing the situation, the authority of the factory took steps to pacify the workers. The authority announced through loud speaker that the news was a rumour and no fire had broken out. Actually, a pipe containing colour had burst out in the dying section but it caused no casualties. After hearing this announcement twice, the workers understood their follies and went back to their work.

sub_questions.explanation:
"The Lion and the Mouse."
Once a lion was sleeping in a cave. Suddenly, a mouse came there. It did not notice the sleeping lion. It was running about and playing nearby. By chance, the mouse ran over the lion's face and tickled its nose with its tiny feet. The lion woke up with a loud roar, startled and furious. With a swift paw, it caught the mouse. Trembling with fear, the mouse begged for its life, saying, "Please spare me, O King of the Jungle! If you let me go, I promise to help you someday."
The lion laughed at the thought of such a tiny creature helping a mighty beast like himself but decided to let the mouse go. "You are too small to be a meal anyway," the lion said, releasing the mouse. The mouse scurried away, thankful for the lion's mercy.
A few days later, the lion was caught in a hunter's net while prowling through the forest. Struggling to free himself, the lion roared in frustration, shaking the entire jungle. Hearing the loud roars, the mouse hurried to the scene. Recognizing the lion, the mouse said, "Don't worry, I will help you."
The little mouse began gnawing at the thick ropes of the net with its sharp teeth. Slowly but surely, the net weakened and broke, setting the lion free. Grateful, the lion said, "I underestimated you, little friend. Today, you taught me that even the smallest creature can do great deeds."
The two became unlikely friends, proving that kindness and gratitude transcend size and strength.

Lina's Ready Wit
Lina is a student of class ten. One day, in the afternoon she was gossiping with her friend beside a pond near her house. While gossiping she noticed two small boys quarrelling over a trifling matter. She did not take it seriously thinking that their quarrel would come to an end soon. But it turned out to be a serious one. At one point of time, one of the boys picked up a big stone to throw it to the other whereas the other boy started to throw pebbles at him one after another. Being hit by the pebbles, the boy with a heavy stone in his hand, became imbalanced and fell in the pond. In the water, he became so scared that he couldn't swim and started to drown. In the meantime, the other boy, being panicked, fled away. Lina and her friend saw the boy drowning and rushed to the spot. They cried for help but nobody was around. All of a sudden, Lina saw a fishing net nearby. She took the net and hurled it to the boy. When the boy got hold of the net, Lina and her friend pulled it with all their might and brought the drowning boy to the land. Meanwhile, some villagers gathered at the spot and took the boy to the hospital. The people then praised Lina for her ready wit and thus, she became a star of her village.
